author: YuriySamorodov
body:
Simple as that,
Code is not being highlighted in pwsh 6.2.0-rc.1

<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6?view=powershell-6).

-->

# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
$host
```

# Expected behavior
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5260172/54635527-68c78700-4a95-11e9-8704-7e148db82165.png)


# Actual behavior
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5260172/54635542-75e47600-4a95-11e9-9053-77694c9e47fa.png)


# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name             : ConsoleHost
Version          : 6.2.0-rc.1
InstanceId       : 20ad1bf2-69de-44e5-9baa-0321535fb2dd
UI               : System.Management.Automation.Internal.Host.InternalHostUserInterface
CurrentCulture   : en-US
CurrentUICulture : en-US
PrivateData      : Microsoft.PowerShell.ConsoleHost+ConsoleColorProxy
DebuggerEnabled  : True
IsRunspacePushed : False
Runspace         : System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.LocalRunspace
```

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
Call `Get-Module` and check that `PSReadLine` is imported?

If not, try to import it manually with `Import-Module` and see if there are any errors on import. 😄

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body: @YuriySamorodov what output do you get from `Get-PSReadLineOption`?

comments.author: YuriySamorodov
comments.body:
@vexx32 
```Output
Get-PSReadLineOption : The type initializer for 'Microsoft.PowerShell.PSConsoleReadLine' threw an exception.
At line:1 char:1
+ Get-PSReadLineOption
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [Get-PSReadLineOption], TypeInitializationException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.TypeInitializationException,Microsoft.PowerShell.GetPSReadLineOption
```

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
Looks like the little birdie on the PowerShell Discord was correct. 

What's your keyboard layout?

/cc @lzybkr @SteveL-MSFT

comments.author: YuriySamorodov
comments.body: @vexx32 I have two: en-US (main) and ru-RU (secondary)

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @YuriySamorodov There's a known issue with non en-US keyboard layouts and PSReadLine 2.0.0-beta3.  A fix has already been made in master branch of PSReadLine, but there hasn't been a release yet.  Working with @lzybkr on getting a release out.

comments.author: YuriySamorodov
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT @lzybkr Thank you very much for taking your time to explain what is going on in detail. Probably we can reference issues #9168 #9169 and PSReadline bug you were working on?

title: pwsh 6.2.0-rc.1 No Code Highlighting
